data.title: All 88 Billy Wilder Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to embark on a cinematic journey through time with the Billy Wilder Movies roundup article. This insightful piece delves into the iconic filmmakerâ€™s extensive portfolio, exploring theâ€¦

Samantha Kerr

Get ready to embark on a cinematic journey through time with the Billy Wilder Movies roundup article. This insightful piece delves into the iconic filmmakerâ€™s extensive portfolio, exploring the themes, characters, and unforgettable moments that have left an indelible mark on the world of cinema. Whether youâ€™re a film enthusiast or a newcomer to the world of Wilder, youâ€™re sure to find something captivating in this compelling roundup.

As an Amazonâ„¢ Associate, we earn from qualifying purchases.

1. People on Sunday (1930)

People on Sundayâ€ is a captivating German film directed by Czech director Robert Siodmak, released in 1930. Set in Berlin, Germany, the film follows a group of young people as they enjoy a leisurely Sunday at the beach, escaping the relentless toil of the working week. The film has a unique blend of comedy, drama, and romance that showcases the lives of these young people amidst their struggles and joys.

ğŸ“º Watch now free with Prime

ğŸ–¼ï¸ Check out these cool movie posters & art

Step into the world of a lively, captivating musical romance set in the picturesque town of Heidelberg. â€œEin Burschenlied aus Heidelbergâ€ is an enchanting journey starring Hans Brausewetter, Betty Bird, and Willi Forst. This 1930 German film, directed by Karl Hartl and written by Ernst Neubach, Billy Wilder, and Hans Wilhelm, takes viewers to a time where love, music, and camaraderie come together in a memorable tale.
